newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville still out of next-day peak power market.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville still out of next-day peak power market.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) continued to offer no power during peak demand hours on Tuesday, the agency said Monday.
BPA had pulled out of the on-peak market on Wednesday, citing power line restrictions, outage of a hydroelectric turbine at the Grand Coulee dam, and curtailments at the WNP-2 nuclear plant.
BPA continued to offer firm and non-firm power during off-peak hours on Tuesday at prices unchanged from Monday's preschedulings.
Tuesday non-firm power during off-peak blocks was offered at $12.50 per megawatt hour (MWh) for both Northwest and California-Oregon border (COB) deliveries, while weekend prices were $11.50.
Non-firm prices for hours ending 0100-0500 and 2400 were unchanged at $12.50 for all deliveries, while power during hours ending 0600 and 2300 was offered at $13.50.
BPA also continued to offer displacement power for hours ending 0100-0600 and 2400 PST at $9.00 per MWh and at $7.00 for Northwest buyers only.
